c894b0eb-58e1-4a0b-8f22-5ab38d6baa28.description: The badge earner is someone who has been able to unpack and uncover their purpose throughout their Life Design journey. They are someone who can clearly articulate not only what contribution they want to make to the world but have been able to design a plan to prototype this contribution as part of their next steps.
c894b0eb-58e1-4a0b-8f22-5ab38d6baa28.name: Purpose - Foundational

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Explain in detail, their strengths, interests and motivations.
Describe how their SIM looks in action
Can connect their SIM to future endeavours
Understand their purpose
Can explain the contribution they want to make in the world
Discuss the impact that they aim to have through their contribution

f09a68a8-bf09-472b-9428-6e1670ceee40.description: Staff participation in a 10 hour course on stretch and challenge of all learners within the classroom. This two day face to face course engages teachers in how to challenge and stretch all learners. Options are presented throughout the two days to model workshopping within the classroom and to engage different needs of teachers. All options are around differentiation of students.
f09a68a8-bf09-472b-9428-6e1670ceee40.name: Challenge and Stretch for all Learners

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: 1.1.2 Teachers will explore data that indicates student's capabilities at that age, and design learning through different teaching strategies to engage this level.
1.5.2 Teachers examine and apply a range of strategies to meet the needs of all learners in their classroom
2.1.2 Teachers apply their learning within each workshop to their content knowledge areas in order to develop engaging teaching activities
2.5.2 Teachers examine literacy and numeracy data in order to understand their learners and then design teaching strategies to support a range of learners.
7.4.2 Teachers will engage with a network of practitioners across a K-12 landscape in order to broaden their knowledge in a range of student abilities.

e202855f-903c-49b0-bc2b-5b6a93419ebe.description: Students investigate a range of work environments, explore the different types of work and skills for employment and analyses employment options and strategies for career management. Students complete a job application in the form of a resume and cover letter for a role, and then sit an interview with a recruiter from that industry.
e202855f-903c-49b0-bc2b-5b6a93419ebe.name: Preparing Job Applications

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Researches and formulate responses to common interview questions related to the industry
Create a portfolio that is relevant to bring into the interview in order to demonstrate achievements or skills
Participate in an interview with a recruiter from industry
Present a quality resume including the skills and capabilities that are brought to the role.
Construct a cover letter relating skills, capabilities and experiences to the role description

71b3683f-31b0-4935-903f-91ca1590de3b.description: This unit introduces participants to the knowledge and skills required to develop their financial literacy. Individuals will learn about the importance of an empowering money mindset as a foundation for developing a positive relationship with money. They will also learn a variety of money management tools, which will enable them to establish supportive money habits and effective financial practice.
71b3683f-31b0-4935-903f-91ca1590de3b.name: Financial Literacy - Foundational

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Identify their limiting beliefs about money and reframe them into empowering money beliefs. Track and categorise their expenses. Set money targets over a 1, 3, 5 or 10 year period. Set up structures that support them with achieving their money targets. Articulate their understanding of financial concepts such as inflation, compound interest, good debt, bad debt, investing, assets and instant gratification. Create a learning plan to further develop their financial literacy knowledge and skills

d2db3a66-fc76-436e-9d8c-d0087d798af2.description: This unit introduces participants to the knowledge and skills required to develop their financial literacy. Individuals will learn about the importance of an empowering money mindset as a foundation for developing a positive relationship with money. They will also learn a variety of money management tools, which will enable them to establish supportive money habits and effective financial practice.
d2db3a66-fc76-436e-9d8c-d0087d798af2.name: Financial Literacy - Mastery

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Identify their limiting beliefs about money, reframe these beliefs and write an empowering money story based on these new beliefs. Accurately track and categorise their expenses. Set intentional money targets over a 1, 3, 5 and 10 year period. Set up thorough structures that support them with achieving their money targets.

Professionally articulate their understanding of financial concepts such as inflation, compound interest, good debt, bad debt, investing, assets and instant gratification. Create a detailed learning plan to further develop their financial literacy knowledge and skills.

e1049453-7edb-4a08-84dc-5aa26d6f5d42.description: The recipient of this credential has followed a process to complete a creative piece of work, developed an idea and documented its process to completion. The management of this project is significant and involves the development, realisation and documentation of design projects. The Major Design Project and supporting folio requires students to select and apply appropriate design, production and evaluation skills to develop and evaluate a product.
e1049453-7edb-4a08-84dc-5aa26d6f5d42.name: Managed a Major Project

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Completes the Design and Technology Course - 120 hours
Completes a significant portfolio documenting the process used to develop the product.
Completes a significant piece of work to develop a physical product, system or environment.
Demonstrates creativity and innovation in the use of tools, materials and techniques to produce a quality product.
Demonstrates persistance in work ethic and motivation
Demonstrates management of a project to completion

13b3b6dd-d54e-476f-a0de-989bf20608ff.description: A high stakes delivery of a presentation that is completed exceptionally well.
13b3b6dd-d54e-476f-a0de-989bf20608ff.name: Presentation Skills: Mastery

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Delivers an exceptional quality presentation to a high stakes audience
Engages with the audience to a professional level
Timing, flow and delivery is well structured and practiced.

8e3d8d63-6ac8-48ce-b022-c3586cb36596.description: Students have demonstrated competency in safely and efficiently utilising Computer-aided design software and 3D Printing technology to prototype and develop complex 3dimensional products.
8e3d8d63-6ac8-48ce-b022-c3586cb36596.name: Skills for Manufacturing: 3D Printer

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Completes safety test and demonstrates safe use of the 3D Printer.
Creates a product using Computer Aided Design Software
Successfully and independently utilises the 3D printer to construct a product.

71336bab-2b99-400f-bc61-5f36b5a7f9f0.description: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to follow a design process at a basic level, incorporating an element of problem solving to identify and resolve challenges that may hinder the process. It applies to individuals who work under direct supervision and respond to specific issues or changes which may relate to product and service requirements.
71336bab-2b99-400f-bc61-5f36b5a7f9f0.name: Follow a design process: Foundational

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Students complete two design projects which indicates their ability to determine project objectives, possible constraints and required support materials collaborate with others when generating ideas, solving problems, and seeking approvals and feedback schedule tasks and create project documentation to support proposed solutions review work to determine future improvements.

Students must demonstrate through a portfolio of evidence and interview of their ability to: describe creative thinking techniques that can be used to generate ideas summarise the key steps in the design process as a way of thinking and solving problems list potential sources of information for new ideas, relevant to specific context.

ea7394e4-8ea0-40ed-9531-1b8833881b65.description: Students complete volunteer service support as a technical support officer at St Luke's Catholic College. This includes completing 40 hours of technical support, and completion of the below service and technical competencies.
ea7394e4-8ea0-40ed-9531-1b8833881b65.name: Information Technology Support Service Hours

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Completes 40 hours of professional experience as a junior technical support officer.
Works professionally and politely with clients.
Manages complex situations and clients
Manages and services peripherals - VOIP phones, printers, display devices
Provides physical resources and support through the development of help manuals.
Manages tasks with ticketing systems and responds appropriately in written format through emails.
Works with media and display devices

b751ec51-155a-4496-93ef-1bc57582ad8c.description: This leadership badge is based on the work of Brendan Burchard "Student leadership" which speaks to the fact that leadership doesn’t come from a particular personality style or position, it’s a set of skills and practises and can be learned. He taught us that leaders enjoy more success when they think of their team as collaborators rather than followers, and focus on creating a transformative, empowering, experience for their team, that keeps their team engaged and inspired by their work.
b751ec51-155a-4496-93ef-1bc57582ad8c.name: Leadership: Foundational

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Envision a preferred solution and create goals and strategies to achieve that vision.
Identify key drivers that they need to enlist and ensures that the right people are enlisted in developing their preferred future
Embody and model the practices that are necessary to achieve this change - ie, "leading by example"
Empowers others to achieve similar goals. Servant leaders find out what other people need and what they aspire to achieve, and help them to do so.
Evaluates by systematically and frequently measuring progress towards the goal and adjusts strategies based on this evaluation
Encourages and lifts others to be involved.

4e4a3444-184d-4de4-9401-29f4766107e3.description: Students can identify elements of who they are, what they can do and what problems they can solve through understanding their individual strengths and how that contributes to the way that they work, interact and solve problems. This badge is one component of the full "Pathway to My Purpose: SIM Unlocked" badge.
4e4a3444-184d-4de4-9401-29f4766107e3.name: Pathway to purpose: Strengths

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Reflect on their strengths and describe their uniqueness in relation to their strengths
Understand themselves as people and as learners
Recognise and identify their own talents and gifts and strengths Identify examples of strengths
Recognise personal qualities and achievements Develop an understanding of personal potential

68bee326-de60-4f97-bdba-d80e1a39d470.description: The badge earner is someone who has been able to unpack and uncover their purpose throughout their Life Design journey. They are someone who can clearly articulate not only what contribution they want to make to the world but have been able to design a plan to prototype this contribution as part of their next steps.
68bee326-de60-4f97-bdba-d80e1a39d470.name: Purpose - Master

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Explain in detail, their strengths, interests and motivations.
Describe how their SIM looks in action
Can connect their SIM to future endeavours
Understand their purpose
Can explain the contribution they want to make in the world
Discuss the impact that they aim to have through their contribution
Have a clear plan in place to prototype ways to contribute to their purpose problems
Can explain how this plan for prototyping their purpose will help them in the greater contribution to their purpose problem.

505d0562-7fa2-4510-a85c-ccc76f468b4e.description: Students have demonstrated competency in safely and efficiently utilising Computer-aided design software and CNC technology to prototype and develop products
505d0562-7fa2-4510-a85c-ccc76f468b4e.name: Skills for Manufacturing: CNC Mill

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Completes safety test and demonstrates safe use of the CNC Mill independently.
Uses CAD Software to construct a model that utilises multiple levels of depth across X and Y and Z axes
Successfully and independently utilises the CNC Mill
Utilises CAM technology to convert a CAD model to G-Code to drive the machine.
Successfully selects tools and materials within the CAM technology to ensure a successful milled product.
Aligns materials within the CNC Machine and sets origin of machine.

efcd37f5-f2bd-43f3-b015-7037bcd23ab7.description: Students have demonstrated competency in safely and efficiently utilising Computer-aided design software (Adobe Illustrator) and laser cutting technology to prototype and develop products
efcd37f5-f2bd-43f3-b015-7037bcd23ab7.name: Skills for Manufacturing: Laser Cutting

issuer.summary: issued by St Luke's Catholic College

badge_template_activities.title: Completes safety test and demonstrates safe use of the laser cutter independently a number of times.
Uses Adobe Illustrator to construct a product specific for the laser cutter, with both engraving and cutting lines.
Successfully and independently utilises the laser cutter.
Adjusts material and depth settings successfully in the laser cutter.
